CatDescriptText: Mr. John Brock, 7234 Kedron Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 30, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that Negroes make full use of their voting franchise by registering and voting in both the primary and the general election?"  Answer reads: "No, I don't. And it seems as though they are just too lazy.  I think that if they did it would benefit us a whole lot.  This probably would result in such things as better housing and higher standards of living and better wages."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John Brock wearing light colored shirt standing on sidewalk with pedestrians and G. C. Murphy in background
